name: Allergic Contact Dermatitis
chief_complaint: I have a red, itchy rash on my arm that won't go away.
physical_findings: vesicles or blisters in affected area
prognosis: Excellent with allergen avoidance; symptoms typically resolve within 2-4 weeks
description: A delayed hypersensitivity reaction occurring when skin comes into contact with an allergen, leading to localized inflammation. Common allergens include nickel, fragrances, and certain plants like poison ivy.
